humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma in the right breast, measuring 3.1 cm in size. Based on the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm, and T4 tumors are of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin. Since the tumor size is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, it is mentioned that the size of the infiltrating ductal carcinoma is 3.1 cm. According to the TNM staging system for breast cancer, a tumor size of 2.1 to 5.0 cm corresponds to T2 stage. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
